results.title: Cringe and they'll come running: an environmental study
results.creator_credit: Bill Meyer, Experimental Film and Television Fund and Skin and Hair Flick Co
results.brief_description: In this film, a broad spectrum of well-known contemporary Melbourne artists comment on their own work, their relationships with other artists, and the nature of Australian art. Focuses on the relationship between art and the environment, contrasting urban with the rural landscape, and realism with modernism and conceptualism. Shows the art of sculpture blending into the city landscape and includes many visual images of Melbourne city and suburbs such as the newly opened Tullamarine Airport, National Gallery of Victoria, the freeways and overpasses and high-rise development constructed during the sixties, local art galleries and museums as well as outer Melbourne bush and bayside scenes. Artists include: Bruce Pollard, John Brack, Kevin Gronow, Alun Leach-Jones, Clifford Last, Ruth McNicoll, Lenton Parr, Jan Senbergs, Guy Stuart, Trevor Kretchmar, Andrew Sibley, Dennis Spiteri, Fred Williams and others. Contains some B&W footage.

results.title: Crimson tide
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Two military men from different eras collide when their submarine is engaged in possible nuclear warfare. Gene Hackman plays an old-school captain, fearsome to his staff and a stickler for rules; Denzel Washington plays Lt. Commander Ron Hunter, a Harvard graduate who believes preventing conflict is also the role of the armed forces. As these two face off over the possibility of war, tensions, egos and threats soar. Cast also includes James Gandolfini and Matt Craven.

results.title: Crimes of the Heart
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Bruce Beresford, Freddie Fields and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Unconventional comedy in which three writers reunite and share their problems, eccentricities and idiosyncrasies during a reunion. The youngest has just been released from prison after shooting her husband because he beat up her black lover. During their time together assorted family secrets are revealed. Based on play of the same name by Beth Henley, which won a Pulitzer Prize. Stars Diane Keaton, Jessica Lange and Sissy Spacek.

results.title: Crimes of passion
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell, Donald P. Borchers, Barry Sandler and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: Kathleen Turner leads a double life in this film by Ken Russell. By day she is Joanna, a sportswear designer, but by night she transforms herself to China-Blue, a hooker servicing a variety of sexual fantasies. Among her regular clients is a sinister preacher (Anthony Perkins) who carries his obsession with China-Blue to a chilling extreme.

results.title: Crimes of carelessness
results.brief_description: Depicts the appalling loss of life and property which results from preventable fires. The principle unsafe practices which cause fires are illustrated - then safe ways of doing the same things are shown.

results.title: Crimes and misdemeanors
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenhut, Orion Pictures Corporation and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Beginning with small betrayals, infidelity, lies… and ending in murder; this is a bold and unflinching expose on the choices people make. Martin Landau is a respected, wealthy doctor whose world begins to crumble around him when his mistress (Anjelica Huston) threatens him with blackmail. Desperate, he must decide whether he can face getting rid of her - permanently! As a balance to this chilling tragedy, Woody Allen stars as an insecure documentary filmmaker about to tackle the hardest job of his life - filming a glowing tribute to the man he hates most in the world - his brother-in-law, played by Alan Alda. Also stars Caroline Aaron, Joanna Gleason, Claire Bloom, Jenny Nichols, Mia Farrow, Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.

results.title: Crime: senior alert
results.creator_credit: Ronald Floethe, Gordon Kerkhoff and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Crime against the elderly is on the increase. This film offers sensible information which, if followed, will help protect them against the potential criminal. Gives tips on preventing residential burglary, purse snatchers, developing safe car habits and avoiding high-risk areas.

results.title: Crime over London
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zeisler, Marcel Hellman and Criterion Ltd
results.brief_description: A British drama revolving around a store owner who shelters gangsters trying to evade the law. Cast includes Margot Grahame, Paul Cavanagh, Joseph Cawthorn, Basil Sydney and Rene Ray. Written by Norman Alexander and Harold French, based on the novel ‘House of a Thousand Windows’ by Louis De Wohl. Photographed by Victor Armenise and Claude Friese-Greene. Edited by Conrad von Molo.

results.title: Crime on the streets
results.brief_description: This film recounts the high occurence of street crimes, including theft, burglary, assault and rape. Shows how the behaviour of victim often encourages criminals. Suggests ways of protecting the individuals as well as his/her property from attack. Featuring an interview with Chuck Norris.

results.title: Crime Inc. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: The second and last volume of this series turns to the efforts of crimefighters such as J. Edgar Hoover to stop organized crime, and shows the extent of the gangsters’ control of gambling in Las Vegas and Atlantic City. Multi-million dollar gambling empires are run by criminals, despite strict supervision and laws. The video consists of two parts: “Racket busters” and “Birthright of gangsters.” Written and narrated by Martin Short.
